Registry of Open Data on AWS

International Neuroimaging Data-Sharing Initiative (INDI)

Homo sapiens life sciences magnetic resonance imaging neuroimaging neuroscience

Description

This bucket contains multiple neuroimaging datasets that are part of the International Neuroimaging Data-Sharing Initiative. Raw human and non-human primate neuroimaging data include 1) Structural MRI; 2) Functional MRI; 3) Diffusion Tensor Imaging; 4) Electroencephalogram (EEG) In addition to the raw data, preprocessed data is also included for some datasets. A complete list of the available datasets can be seen in the documentation lonk provided below.

Update Frequency

Each dataset within INDI has its own release schedule. See release date and frequency for [each dataset](http://fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/IndiPro.html)

License

ODC-By v1.0 for imaging data and BSD 3-Clause for CPAC, unless otherwise specified

Documentation

http://fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/

Tools & Applications
  • Configurable Pipeline for the Analysis of Connectomes (C-PAC) by [INDI C-PAC Team](https://fcp-indi.github.io/)
Publications
  • Accelerating the Evolution of Nonhuman Primate Neuroimaging by M.P. Milham, C. Petkov
  • An Open Resource for Non-human Primate Imaging by M.P. Milham, L. Ai, ..., C.E. Schroeder
  • An open resource for transdiagnostic research in pediatric mental health and learning disorders by L.M. Alexander, J. Escalera, ..., M.P. Milham
  • Assessment of the impact of shared brain imaging data on the scientific literature by M.P. Milham, R.C. Craddock, ..., A. Klein
  • Enhancing studies of the connectome in autism using the autism brain imaging data exchange II. by A. Di Martino, D. O'Connor, M.P. Milham
  • Making data sharing work: The FCP/INDI experience by M. Mennes, B.B. Biswal, F.X. Castellanos, M.P. Milham
  • The autism brain imaging data exchange: towards a large-scale evaluation of the intrinsic brain architecture in autism. by A. Di Martino, C-G Yan, ..., M.P. Milham
  • The Healthy Brain Network Serial Scanning Initiative: a resource for evaluating inter-individual differences and their reliabilities across scan conditions and sessions by D. O'Connor, N.V. Potler, ..., M.P. Milham
  • The NKI-Rockland sample: a model for accelerating the pace of discovery science in psychiatry by K.B. Nooner, S.J. Colcombe, ..., M.P. Milham

Resources on AWS

  • Description
    Neuroimaging data for the International Neuroimaging Data-Sharing Initiative (INDI)
    Resource type
    S3 Bucket
    Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
    arn:aws:s3:::fcp-indi
    AWS Region
    us-east-1
    AWS CLI Access (No AWS account required)
    aws s3 ls s3://fcp-indi/ --no-sign-request
